intro: Rubus soulieanus, commonly known as the Sulié blackberry, is a species of bramble native to China. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, dark berries that are often used in traditional Chinese medicine. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
